title: China Eximbank provides RMB 2.54 billion government concessional loan for Phase 2 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project (Linked to Project ID#66525 and #67382)
description: On February 11, 2018, the Export-Import Bank of China and Belagroprombank — a state-owned bank in Belarus — signed two loan agreements for Phase 1 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project: an RMB 1.75 billion government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No. (2017) 36 TOTAL NO. (641)] and a $50 million USD buyer’s credit loan (BCL) agreement. The GCL, which is captured via Project ID#66525, carries a 15-year maturity and an interest rate of 2%. The borrowing terms of the BCL, which is captured via Project ID#67382, are unknown.  Then, on June 11, 2018, China Eximbank and Belagroprombank signed an RMB 2.54 billion government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No. (2017) 37 TOTAL NO. (642)] for Phase 2 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project. The second GCL, which is captured via Project ID#66526, carries a 15-year maturity and an interest rate of 2%.  Belagroprombank on-lent the proceeds from the GCLs and the BCL to a special purpose vehicle (SPV) called CJSC Belarusian National Biotechnology Corporation (BNBC). The proceeds from the GCLs and the BCL were then to be used by the ultimate borrower, BNBC, to finance a three-year, $853.19 million (RMB 4.29 billion) commercial engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) contract between CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. and BNBC, which was signed on November 26, 2016.  This project involved the construction of a new amino acid plant, a high-tech balanced compound feed production plant, a grain silo project with drying facilities, a combined heat and power station, and supporting infrastructure (such as railways, highways, natural gas pipelines, and transmission lines) in Pukhovichi District within Minsk Oblast. Upon completion, the agro-industrial complex is expected to process 250,000 tons of grain (wheat/triticale) per year and produce 64,700 tons of lysine, 5,900 tons of L-threonine, 1,300 tons of L-tryptophan, 23,000 tons of gluten, 99,000 tons of lysine-containing feed, 15,000 tons of ammonium sulfate crystals, and 10,000 tons of liquid ammonium sulfate. The project was also expected meet the future needs of cattle breeders for ‘essential amino acids.’ Its products will be sold domestically and abroad. CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. is the EPC contractor responsible for implementation. Construction commenced on July 27, 2018 and was expected to last for 36 months. On March 26, 2019, a formal groundbreaking ceremony for the Belarusian agro-industrial complex project took place. By end of 2020, the project had achieved a 73% completion rate.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as Phase I of Hi-Tech Agro-Industrial Full Cycle Complex Project for 2016-2032, the First Stage of a High-Tech Agribusiness Project in Pukhovichi District, the First Stage of the Hi-Tech Agro-Industrial Full Cycle Complex Project for 2016-2032, and the Organization high-tech agro-industrial production of complete cycle for 2016 - 2032 (Stage 1) Project. The Russian project title is «Организация высокотехнологичного агропромышленного производства полного цикла на 2016 – 2032 годы» (I этап). The Chinese project title is 白俄罗斯全循环高科技农工综合体项目 or 高科技农工生产项目（二期] or 白俄罗斯全循环高科技农工综合体项目 or 2０1６－２０３２年全循环高科技农工综合体.2. None of the China Eximbank loans that supported this project are included in the China’s Overseas Development Finance Dataset that Boston University's Global Development Policy Center published in December 2020.3. Some sources claim that Bank of China rather than China Eximbank provided a $50 million USD loan for this project. This issue merits further investigation.4. CJSC Belarusian National Biotechnology Corporation (BNBC) is a special purpose vehicle that is minority-owned by the Government of Belarus. It is a joint venture of the Government of Belarus (a 25% ownership stake), CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. (a 20% ownership stake), COFCO Corporation (a 9% ownership stake), Russian Viren-Invest (a1% ownership stake). Two Scottish companies (Maxforce LP and Altastar LP) and two companies from the United Arab Emirates (Al Salaam Biotech Investments Ltd and Al Ziad Agro Investments Ltd) collectively hold a 45% ownership stake in BNBC. The Russian name and abbreviation for CJSC Belarusian National Biotechnology Corporation (BNBC) is ЗАО «Белорусская национальная биотехнологическая корпорация» (ЗАО «БНБК»). BNBC's website can be found here: https://bnbc.by/.5. The agro-industrial complex uses modern biotechnology to deeply process the grains of crops, produce irreplaceable amino acids (lysine, tryptophan, etc.), and further produce high-yield and high-tech balanced compound feed and biological activator. The complex consists of a lysine plant with an annual output of 50,000 tons, a tryptophan plant with an annual output of 5,000 tons, a high-tech balanced compound feed production plant with an annual output of 1 million tons, an oil crop processing plant with an annual output of 300,000 tons, 600,000-ton silos and grain depots with drying facilities, construction of a grain raw material production base with an annual output of 1 million tons, supporting infrastructure projects, and on-site pipe networks.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
China Eximbank provides RMB 2.54 billion government concessional loan for Phase 2 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project (Linked to Project ID#66525 and #67382)

# Description
On February 11, 2018, the Export-Import Bank of China and Belagroprombank — a state-owned bank in Belarus — signed two loan agreements for Phase 1 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project: an RMB 1.75 billion government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No. (2017) 36 TOTAL NO. (641)] and a $50 million USD buyer’s credit loan (BCL) agreement. The GCL, which is captured via Project ID#66525, carries a 15-year maturity and an interest rate of 2%. The borrowing terms of the BCL, which is captured via Project ID#67382, are unknown.  Then, on June 11, 2018, China Eximbank and Belagroprombank signed an RMB 2.54 billion government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No. (2017) 37 TOTAL NO. (642)] for Phase 2 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project. The second GCL, which is captured via Project ID#66526, carries a 15-year maturity and an interest rate of 2%.  Belagroprombank on-lent the proceeds from the GCLs and the BCL to a special purpose vehicle (SPV) called CJSC Belarusian National Biotechnology Corporation (BNBC). The proceeds from the GCLs and the BCL were then to be used by the ultimate borrower, BNBC, to finance a three-year, $853.19 million (RMB 4.29 billion) commercial engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) contract between CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. and BNBC, which was signed on November 26, 2016.  This project involved the construction of a new amino acid plant, a high-tech balanced compound feed production plant, a grain silo project with drying facilities, a combined heat and power station, and supporting infrastructure (such as railways, highways, natural gas pipelines, and transmission lines) in Pukhovichi District within Minsk Oblast. Upon completion, the agro-industrial complex is expected to process 250,000 tons of grain (wheat/triticale) per year and produce 64,700 tons of lysine, 5,900 tons of L-threonine, 1,300 tons of L-tryptophan, 23,000 tons of gluten, 99,000 tons of lysine-containing feed, 15,000 tons of ammonium sulfate crystals, and 10,000 tons of liquid ammonium sulfate. justification: Project focuses on agricultural and industrial development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of amino acid plant, feed production plant, grain silo, and supporting infrastructure; no specific energy transition or environmental focus mentioned

title: Chinese Government provides funds for Minsk State Linguistic University's Chinese Department
description: On March 2, 2018, an opening ceremony was held for the new Chinese Department at Minsk State Linguistic University. The department will help students learn more about Chinese language and culture, as well as strengthen the intercultural ties between China and Belarus. The department has close ties with East China Normal University, Peking University of Foreign Languages, Tianjin University of Foreign Languages ​​, and Shanghai University of Foreign Languages. It is the first department of Chinese language and studies in the Republic of Belarus.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Government provides funds for Minsk State Linguistic University's Chinese Department

# Description
On March 2, 2018, an opening ceremony was held for the new Chinese Department at Minsk State Linguistic University. The department will help students learn more about Chinese language and culture, as well as strengthen the intercultural ties between China and Belarus. The department has close ties with East China Normal University, Peking University of Foreign Languages, Tianjin University of Foreign Languages ​​, and Shanghai University of Foreign Languages. It is the first department of Chinese language and studies in the Republic of Belarus.
justification: Project focuses on education and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Establishment of Chinese language department, focus on cultural and educational ties

title: China Eximbank provides $50 million USD buyer’s credit loan for Phase 1 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project (Linked to Project ID#66526 and #66525)
description: On February 11, 2018, the Export-Import Bank of China and Belagroprombank — a state-owned bank in Belarus — signed two loan agreements for Phase 1 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project: an RMB 1.75 billion government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No. (2017) 36 TOTAL NO. (641)] and a $50 million buyer’s credit loan (BCL) agreement. The GCL, which is captured via Project ID#66525, carries a 15-year maturity and an interest rate of 2%. The borrowing terms of the BCL, which is captured via Project ID#67382, are unknown. Then, on June 11, 2018, China Eximbank and Belagroprombank signed an RMB 2.54 billion government concessional loan (GCL) agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK GCL No. (2017) 37 TOTAL NO. (642)] for Phase 2 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project. The second GCL, which is captured via Project ID#66526, carries a 15-year maturity and an interest rate of 2%. Belagroprombank on-lent the proceeds from the GCLs and the BCL to a special purpose vehicle (SPV) called CJSC Belarusian National Biotechnology Corporation (BNBC). The proceeds from the GCLs and the BCL were to be used by the ultimate borrower, BNBC, to finance a three-year, $853.19 million (RMB 4.29 billion) engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) contract between CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. and BNBC, which was signed on November 26, 2016. The loans appears to be secured by (i.e. collateralized against) cash deposits in escrow accounts (or so-called ‘special accounts’). In November 2021, the Government of Belarus transferred responsibility for the  'special accounts' from Belagroprombank to Belarusbank. The project involved the construction of a new amino acid plant, a high-tech balanced compound feed production plant, a grain silo project with drying facilities, a combined heat and power station, and supporting infrastructure (such as railways, highways, natural gas pipelines, and transmission lines) in Pukhovichi District within Minsk Oblast. Upon completion, the agro-industrial complex is expected to process 250,000 tons of grain (wheat/triticale) per year and produce 64,700 tons of lysine, 5,900 tons of L-threonine, 1,300 tons of L-tryptophan, 23,000 tons of gluten, 99,000 tons of lysine-containing feed, 15,000 tons of ammonium sulfate crystals, and 10,000 tons of liquid ammonium sulfate. The project was also expected meet the future needs of cattle breeders for ‘essential amino acids.’ Its products will be sold domestically and abroad. CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. is the EPC contractor responsible for implementation. Construction commenced on July 27, 2018 and was originally expected to last for 36 months (estimated end date: July 27, 2021). On March 26, 2019, a formal groundbreaking ceremony for the Belarusian agro-industrial complex project took place. By end of 2020, the project had achieved a 73% completion rate. On October 31, 2021, CITIC Construction Co., Ltd.  produced the first batch of lysine sulfate. Then, on November 8, 2021, CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. produced the first batch of first wheat gluten. Then, on December 21, 2021, CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. produced the first batch of threonine. The construction of all Phase 1 and Phase 2 facilities was completed in December 2021 and all facilities were put into operation in November 2022. On August 6, 2020, CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. and BNBC signed a $547 million (RMB 3.8 billion) general EPC contract for Phase 3 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project. A Phase 3 feasibility study was subsequently completed and Phase 2 was approved by a Government of Belarus Commission for Foreign Exchange and Credit. Then, on November 5, 2021,  CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. and BNBC signed a revised EPC contract for Phase 3 of the Agro-Industrial Complex Project worth RMB 4.8 billion. Yang Jianqiang, Deputy President of CITIC Construction Co., Ltd.  and Danil Uritsky, General Director of BNBC, signed the contract on behalf of their respective organizations at the project site.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as Phase I of Hi-Tech Agro-Industrial Full Cycle Complex Project for 2016-2032, the First Stage of a High-Tech Agribusiness Project in Pukhovichi District, the First Stage of the Hi-Tech Agro-Industrial Full Cycle Complex Project for 2016-2032, and the Organization high-tech agro-industrial production of complete cycle for 2016 - 2032 (Stage 1) Project. The Russian project title is «Организация высокотехнологичного агропромышленного производства полного цикла на 2016 – 2032 годы» (I этап). The Chinese project title is 白俄罗斯全循环高科技农工综合体项目 or 高科技农工生产项目（二期] or 白俄罗斯全循环高科技农工综合体项目 or 2０1６－２０３２年全循环高科技农工综合体.2. None of the China Eximbank loans that supported this project are included in the China’s Overseas Development Finance Dataset that Boston University's Global Development Policy Center published in December 2020.3. Some sources claim that Bank of China rather than China Eximbank provided a $50 million USD loan for this project. This issue merits further investigation.4. CJSC Belarusian National Biotechnology Corporation (BNBC) is a special purpose vehicle that is minority-owned by the Government of Belarus. It is a joint venture of the Government of Belarus (a 25% ownership stake), CITIC Construction Co., Ltd. (a 20% ownership stake), COFCO Corporation (a 9% ownership stake), Russian Viren-Invest (a 1% ownership stake). Two Scottish companies (Maxforce LP and Altastar LP) and two companies from the United Arab Emirates (Al Salaam Biotech Investments Ltd and Al Ziad Agro Investments Ltd) collectively hold a 45% ownership stake in BNBC. The Russian name and abbreviation for CJSC Belarusian National Biotechnology Corporation (BNBC) is ЗАО «Белорусская национальная биотехнологическая корпорация» (ЗАО «БНБК»). BNBC's website can be found here: https://bnbc.by/.5. The agro-industrial complex uses modern biotechnology to deeply process the grains of crops, produce irreplaceable amino acids (lysine, tryptophan, etc.), and further produce high-yield and high-tech balanced compound feed and biological activator. The complex consists of a lysine plant with an annual output of 50,000 tons, a tryptophan plant with an annual output of 5,000 tons, a high-tech balanced compound feed production plant with an annual output of 1 million tons, an oil crop processing plant with an annual output of 300,000 tons, 600,000-ton silos and grain depots with drying facilities, construction of a grain raw material production base with an annual output of 1 million tons, supporting infrastructure projects, and on-site pipe networks.

justification: Project focuses on agricultural and industrial development without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of amino acid plant, feed production plant, grain silo, and supporting infrastructure; primary purpose is agricultural processing and production

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 576 million grant — via ETCA — for Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#66089)
description: On April 25, 2019, Chinese President Xi Jinping and Belarusian President Lukashenko unveiled a model of the Belarusian National Football Stadium and Swimming Pool Project. Then, on August 6, 2019, Belarusian Economy Minister Dmitry Krutoi announced that the Chinese Government would provide a $235 million grant for the construction of a national football stadium and world-class swimming pool in Minsk. One week later, on August 13, 2019, the President of Belarus signed Decree 306 for the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium [Национальный олимпийский стадион ”Динамо“], and Decree 307 for the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports [Республиканский центр олимпийской подготовки по водным видам спорта]. The RMB 692 million grant commitment from China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) for the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium Construction Project is captured via Project ID#66089, while the RMB 576 million grant commitment from MOFCOM for the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project is captured via Project ID#90334.   The grant funding was drawn from multiple Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreements (ETCAs) that the Chinese Government and the Government of Belarus had previously signed. One of these ETCAs was signed on June 10, 2018 and it committed RMB 800 million for the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium Construction Project, the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project, and other projects. Another ETCA was signed on October 10, 2018. It committed an unknown amount of grant grant funding for the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium Construction Project and the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project.   The purpose of the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project is to construct an aquatic sports facility with 6000 seats in the capital city of Minsk. The design and construction of the project will seek to comply with the requirements of the International Swimming Federation (FINA). The project site is located on Kalvaryiskaya Street in Minsk and it occupies a construction area of 5.75 hectares. The total construction area is approximately 40,000 square meters.   Beijing Construction Engineering Group (BCEG) is the contractor responsible for project implementation. Beijing Architectural Design and Research Institute Co., Ltd. is responsible for project design and management. MOFCOM awarded BCEG an RMB 576 million project implementation contract in May 2020.   A formal project commencement ceremony took place on June 30, 2020. On June 1, 2022, a Chinese subcontractor loaded into a Chinese port a set of prefabricated stand molds for the stadium in Belarus. The project was originally expected to reach completion by December 31, 2023.
staff_comments: 1. Many sources identify a single $235 million grant commitment to build both facilities while others list the total grant commitment as $180 million. AidData has taken into account sources that identify the cost of the stadium alone as $180 million and the swimming pool alone as $60 million to account for the $235 million donation and coded the Project ID#90334 and Project ID#66089 accordingly. 2. These two facilities are also located in different areas of Minsk, despite initial plans for them to be attached. 3. The Chinese project title is 白俄罗斯国际标准游泳馆项目.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 576 million grant — via ETCA — for Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project (Linked to Project ID#66089)

# Description
On April 25, 2019, Chinese President Xi Jinping and Belarusian President Lukashenko unveiled a model of the Belarusian National Football Stadium and Swimming Pool Project. Then, on August 6, 2019, Belarusian Economy Minister Dmitry Krutoi announced that the Chinese Government would provide a $235 million grant for the construction of a national football stadium and world-class swimming pool in Minsk. The RMB 692 million grant commitment from China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) for the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium Construction Project is captured via Project ID#66089, while the RMB 576 million grant commitment from MOFCOM for the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project is captured via Project ID#90334.   The grant funding was drawn from multiple Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreements (ETCAs) that the Chinese Government and the Government of Belarus had previously signed. One of these ETCAs was signed on June 10, 2018 and it committed RMB 800 million for the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium Construction Project, the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project, and other projects. Another ETCA was signed on October 10, 2018. It committed an unknown amount of grant grant funding for the Dynamo National Olympic Stadium Construction Project and the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project.   The purpose of the Republican Center for Olympic Training in Water Sports Construction Project is to construct an aquatic sports facility with 6000 seats in the capital city of Minsk. The design and construction of the project will seek to comply with the requirements of the International Swimming Federation (FINA). The project site is located on Kalvaryiskaya Street in Minsk and it occupies a construction area of 5.75 hectares. The total construction area is approximately 40,000 square meters.   Beijing Construction Engineering Group (BCEG) is the contractor responsible for project implementation. A formal project commencement ceremony took place on June 30, 2020. On June 1, 2022, a Chinese subcontractor loaded into a Chinese port a set of prefabricated stand molds for the stadium in Belarus. The project was originally expected to reach completion by December 31, 2023.
justification: Project is focused on constructing a sports facility with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of aquatic sports facility with 6000 seats, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: Chinese Government donates 1,200 books to the National Library of Belarus
description: On September 21, 2018, the Chinese Government donated more than 1,200 books about China, including Xi Jinping's "The Governance of China", to the National Library of Belarus.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government donates 1,200 books to the National Library of Belarus

# Description
On September 21, 2018, the Chinese Government donated more than 1,200 books about China, including Xi Jinping's "The Governance of China", to the National Library of Belarus.
justification: Project is a cultural donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Book donation to National Library, cultural exchange focus

title: China sends 23rd medical team to Lokossa, Benin
description: On November 27, 2018, China's 23rd medical team, comprised of 15 doctors, arrived to work in Benin for one year. A farewell ceremony for the medical team was held on December 20th, 2019. During the 23rd medical team's service, they had 12,108 outpatient visits, 1,484 surgeries, and 2,146 ward rounds. Additionally, the medical team donated over 1,500 boxes of medicine.  The 23rd medical team was involved in an "Internet + Online consultation and inter-operative video consultation" initiative. To this end, the Zhongbei Remote Consultation Center was founded, offering free consultations to more than 2,000 people. On March 21st, 2019, a "Internet + medical health" remote guidance surgery was completed for the first time in the Monono and Kouffo Provincial Central Hospital. On May 6th, 2019, the 23rd medical team set up a medical treatment tent at the Benin-China recruitment fair.  The 23rd medical team was stated to have gone to Lokossa to operate on Beninese patients. The team was comprised of experts in both traditional medicine like surgery, orthopedics, gynecology, etc., as well as Chinese medicine like acupuncture, cupping, etc.   China has been sending medical teams to Benin every 2 years since January 1978. China originally signed the agreement to send medical teams to Benin in 1976. The Health and Welfare Commission of Ningxia Hui autonomous region (请宁夏卫健委与) is responsible for sending the teams. Over the 41 total years of Chinese medical teams in Benin, there have been over 600 Chinese medical workers, more than 3 million patient visits, 130,000 inpatients, and over 57,000 operations.  Project #35656 captures the 12th medical team; #35657 captures the 13th; #35658 captures the 14th; #35660 captures the 15th; #35661 captures the 16th; #73429 captures the 17th; #73430 captures the 18th; #59639 captures the 19th; #52142 captures the 20th; #59423 captures the 21st; #59438 captures the 22nd.
staff_comments: The Chinese medical team name is 第23批援贝宁医疗队.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China sends 23rd medical team to Lokossa, Benin

# Description
On November 27, 2018, China's 23rd medical team, comprised of 15 doctors, arrived to work in Benin for one year. A farewell ceremony for the medical team was held on December 20th, 2019. During the 23rd medical team's service, they had 12,108 outpatient visits, 1,484 surgeries, and 2,146 ward rounds. Additionally, the medical team donated over 1,500 boxes of medicine.  The 23rd medical team was involved in an "Internet + Online consultation and inter-operative video consultation" initiative. To this end, the Zhongbei Remote Consultation Center was founded, offering free consultations to more than 2,000 people. On March 21st, 2019, a "Internet + medical health" remote guidance surgery was completed for the first time in the Monono and Kouffo Provincial Central Hospital. On May 6th, 2019, the 23rd medical team set up a medical treatment tent at the Benin-China recruitment fair.  The 23rd medical team was stated to have gone to Lokossa to operate on Beninese patients. The team was comprised of experts in both traditional medicine like surgery, orthopedics, gynecology, etc., as well as Chinese medicine like acupuncture, cupping, etc.   China has been sending medical teams to Benin every 2 years since January 1978. China originally signed the agreement to send medical teams to Benin in 1976. The Health and Welfare Commission of Ningxia Hui autonomous region (请宁夏卫健委与) is responsible for sending the teams. Over the 41 total years of Chinese medical teams in Benin, there have been over 600 Chinese medical workers, more than 3 million patient visits, 130,000 inpatients, and over 57,000 operations.  Project #35656 captures the 12th medical team; #35657 captures the 13th; #35658 captures the 14th; #35660 captures the 15th; #35661 captures the 16th; #73429 captures the 17th; #73430 captures the 18th; #59639 captures the 19th; #52142 captures the 20th; #59423 captures the 21st; #59438 captures the 22nd.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare services and medical assistance, with no direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team providing healthcare services, outpatient visits, surgeries, and traditional medicine treatments

title: China Ministry of Commerce hosts training for 258 farmers at Agricultural Technology Demonstration Center in Benin
description: On June 5th, 2018, the opening ceremony of the 2018 Benin Corn High-yield and Laying Hen Breeding Technology Overseas Training Course hosted by the Ministry of Commerce of China and undertaken by the Foreign Economic Cooperation Center of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs was held at the Agricultural Technology Demonstration Center. The training lasted for 20 days, with 13 agricultural experts selected by the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs of China training 4 batches of 258 trainees. A closing ceremony was held on June 23, 2018. This was the largest overseas agriculture training from China at the time.  The content of the training was practical layer breeding and corn planting to increase production technology. Total teaching time came out to 7380 minutes. Secretary-General of the Ministry of Agriculture, Animal Husbandry and Fisheries of Benin, Ms. François Asoba Gong Lan and Counselor Zhang Bohui delivered speeches at the opening ceremony. Ambassador Peng Jingtao and Counselor Zhang Bohui visited to inspect the training course on June 20, 2018.
staff_comments: The Chinese training course title is '2018年贝宁玉米高产、蛋鸡养殖技术海外培训班'
combined_text:

The training lasted for 20 days, with 13 agricultural experts selected by the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs of China training 4 batches of 258 trainees. A closing ceremony was held on June 23, 2018. This was the largest overseas agriculture training from China at the time.  The content of the training was practical layer breeding and corn planting to increase production technology. Total teaching time came out to 7380 minutes. Secretary-General of the Ministry of Agriculture, Animal Husbandry and Fisheries of Benin, Ms. François Asoba Gong Lan and Counselor Zhang Bohui delivered speeches at the opening ceremony. Ambassador Peng Jingtao and Counselor Zhang Bohui visited to inspect the training course on June 20, 2018.
justification: Project focuses on agricultural training and knowledge transfer without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Agricultural technology training, focus on corn production and layer breeding, no direct energy or environmental components

title: Chinese Embassy in Benin provides grant for Benin-China Friendship Primary School Construction Project in Portonovo (Linked to Project ID#68646)
description: On September 24, 2019, a handover ceremony was held for the China-Benin Friendship Primary School (L'Ecole d'Amitié Sino-Béninoise) in Portonovo, Benin. The school has six classrooms equipped with computer equipment and two basketball courts and football fields. The  funding for this project was provided by the Chinese Embassy in Benin and the Houngbédji Foundation. The school was built by China Xinxing Corporation (Group). The handover ceremony of the primary school coincided with a donation of 20 laptops by Huawei. This donation is captured via Project ID#68646).
staff_comments: The Houngbédji Foundation (温贝吉基金会) is likely a foundation established by the then president of Benin's National Assembly Houngbédji. Furthermore, the layout of funding between this organization and the Chinese Embassy is not clear.News articles seem to suggest that the school was committed to in 2018, but this is unclear.
combined_text:

The  funding for this project was provided by the Chinese Embassy in Benin and the Houngbédji Foundation. The school was built by China Xinxing Corporation (Group). title: Chinese Government donates 3700 tons of rice in 2019
description: In September 2018, President Patrice Talon visited Chinese President Xi Jinping. During the meeting, both sides pledged to cooperate on a range of issues. At that meeting, the Chinese Government agreed to donate 3700 metric tons (mt) of rice to the Government of Benin through the World Food Programme (WFP). The rice was earmarked for children in over 1750 primary schools in the country.  On April 16, 2019, the Chinese Government dispatched an envoy to Benin to supervise the implementation of the rice distribution program. Then, on August 9, 2019, the Chinese Government handed the rice over to the Government of Benin. Chinese Ambassador Peng Jingtao (彭惊涛), Beninese officials, and WFP representatives attended the handover ceremony. The estimated monetary value of the rice donation is $1,534,316.
staff_comments: 1. The Chinese project title is 援贝宁粮援项目. 2. To estimate the monetary value of the donation ($1,534,316), AidData takes the international price of a ton of rice in August 2019 ($414.68) and multiplies it by 3700 tons.
combined_text:
# Sector
DEVELOPMENTAL FOOD AID/FOOD SECURITY ASSISTANCE

# Title
Chinese Government donates 3700 tons of rice in 2019

# Description
In September 2018, President Patrice Talon visited Chinese President Xi Jinping. During the meeting, both sides pledged to cooperate on a range of issues. At that meeting, the Chinese Government agreed to donate 3700 metric tons (mt) of rice to the Government of Benin through the World Food Programme (WFP). The rice was earmarked for children in over 1750 primary schools in the country.  On April 16, 2019, the Chinese Government dispatched an envoy to Benin to supervise the implementation of the rice distribution program. Then, on August 9, 2019, the Chinese Government handed the rice over to the Government of Benin. Chinese Ambassador Peng Jingtao (彭惊涛), Beninese officials, and WFP representatives attended the handover ceremony. The estimated monetary value of the rice donation is $1,534,316.
justification: Project is a food aid donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Rice donation for school children, implemented through WFP, focused on food security

title: CTEXIC funds Chinese aid cotton project team to train 54 Benin farmers in high-yield cotton agriculture
description: On September 23rd, 2018, the Chinese aid cotton project team completed trainings on cotton agriculture at the Benin Cotton Research Center. The 54 participants came from 12 different villages in the Borgou Department, Benin. The Chinese agricultural experts taught field management theory and completed on-site trainings. They covered chemical adjustments, pest control, seeding, and other components of high-yield agriculture. China Hi-Tech Group (中国恒天集团)'s subsidiary CTEXIC (China Textile Industry Foreign Economy Technology Cooperation Company, or 中纺对外集团) funded this project.
staff_comments: It is unclear whether this Cotton Research Center is the same as the Chinese Agricultural Demonstration Center. The Chinese project title is 中国援建贝宁棉花种植项目
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
CTEXIC funds Chinese aid cotton project team to train 54 Benin farmers in high-yield cotton agriculture

# Description
On September 23rd, 2018, the Chinese aid cotton project team completed trainings on cotton agriculture at the Benin Cotton Research Center. The 54 participants came from 12 different villages in the Borgou Department, Benin. The Chinese agricultural experts taught field management theory and completed on-site trainings. They covered chemical adjustments, pest control, seeding, and other components of high-yield agriculture. China Hi-Tech Group (中国恒天集团)'s subsidiary CTEXIC (China Textile Industry Foreign Economy Technology Cooperation Company, or 中纺对外集团) funded this project.
justification: Project focuses on agricultural training and capacity building without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Training on cotton agriculture, capacity building for farmers, no direct energy or environmental components
